intro: Saussurea schultzii var. nana, commonly known as the dwarf saussurea, is a low-growing perennial plant native to the alpine regions of Central Asia. It features a rosette of narrow, silver-gray leaves that are densely covered with fine hairs, which help to reduce water loss in its harsh environment. The plant produces small, yellowish flowers arranged in a compact inflorescence, typically blooming in late summer. It thrives in rocky or gravelly soils at high elevations, where it is adapted to cold temperatures and strong winds. Due to its limited distribution and fragile habitat, it is considered a rare and ecologically significant species.
